blog.name: lady-lyas
blog.title: most gracious
blog.description: lya. she/her. “i think we deserve a soft epilogue, my love” tracking #ladylya

summary: “Once she had loved Prince Joffrey with all her heart, and admired and trusted his mother, the queen. They had repaid that love...
body:
“Once she had loved Prince Joffrey with all her heart, and admired and trusted his mother, the queen. They had repaid that love and trust with her fathers head. Sansa would never make that mistake again.”

— Sansa I, from A Clash of Kings.

— Sansa I, from A Clash of Kings.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Godswood
body:
Written for day 2 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt PICNIC or GARDEN or GODSWOOD

Now he’s commanding one of the biggest armies Westeros has ever known, Jon understands why Ned used to come to the Godswood to think. And just like Catelyn, Sansa finds him there to comfort and encourage him.

Canon Divergent / Canon Compliant

Whenever Jon had been looking for Ned, he had always found him here, in the Godswood, facing the wise old tree. As a little boy he had always wondered how someone could spend so much time with a boring tree that didn’t answer and didn’t react, but the older he got, the more he started to understand what Ned had been looking for.

Right now the tree was a calm in the storm. The courtyard of Winterfell was filled with soldiers and dragons. People were screaming, children were crying and horses were trampling around, terrified of the smell of death that lingered in the air. But here in the Godswood it was quiet and empty. It was the only place where the commander of the hugest army in the history of Westeros could think clearly.

Not that the huge amount of thinking he did lately got him anywhere. The army of the death was huge and endless. Whenever one of the living soldiers would fall, they would come back on the opposite side. At first they would simply fight stranger, nameless people with blue eyes. But then they would fight acquaintances and then they would fight friends.

It terrified him. Jon Snow, King in the North, dragon rider and the one living person who had seen death and lived to tell the tale, was terrified of what was to come. Not because he was afraid of dying himself. He had faced death way too often to still fear it. He was afraid of his loved ones dying. He was afraid of his friends and his family dying and not being as lucky as he had been.

But he was mostly afraid for her. He was afraid that somehow, at the end of the war, he would still be standing and she would be a corpse he would have to burn to death or fight to death.

“Jon?”

He looked up when he heard her voice, only a couple of inches behind him. When she placed a hand on his shoulder, he placed his hand on top of hers.

“Your army is waiting for you.” She whispered. Whenever she stood in front of the crowd, right next to him, she always looked fierce, her chin up and her back straight. But whenever they were alone she lowered her guards and showed the softer side he had thought had been destroyed by the monsters she had met. “They’re getting restless and they need someone to guide them.”

Jon let out a deep sigh. “And how should I be able to put them at ease?” He looked at Sansa and her bright blue eyes stared straight into his. “We all know that people are dying. His army is growing. And we’re here, doing nothing but waiting until he’s close enough to fight him.” He tensed all his muscles and clenched his fists.

“I know.” Sansa nodded. “We talked about this often enough.” She squeezed his shoulder. “I know how hard it is for you to stay here, knowing that horrible things are happening outside these walls. But if we scatter the army, we don’t stand a chance. We only have a chance if we fight as one.”

Sometimes it seemed only yesterday that Sansa had been this pretty maiden giggling with her friends and dreaming of a prince charming to swipe her off her feet.

He had often thought her to be shallow and naive. And just like everyone else he had simply underestimated her. He had not seen her calm, her strength and her intelligence. He had never seen how amazing she truly was and he had been a fool not to see it.

“But all those people rely on you, Jon.” She cocked her head slightly. She was taller than him, but somehow looking up at her was one of his favourite things to do. “They have no idea what’s coming for them and what they will face. But you have and you have to remind them what we’re fighting for.” Sansa swallowed. “We’re not fighting for a throne or power. We’re fighting for Westeros and for the living to stay alive.”

“You should have been the queen.” Jon tucked a strand of strawberry blond hair behind her ear. “You’d be able to encourage even the most hopeless man.”

Sansa smiled and curled her fingers around his wrist to press the palm of his hand to her cheek. “Are you hopeless, Jon Snow?”

He didn’t know. Could he do this if he truly felt hopeless? Could he rally an army and lead it straight to their deaths if he believed it was hopeless? Could he ask people to fight a battle if he had no faith that there was a chance, however small, that they would win?

“We have a good strategy.” Sansa stepped towards him and she pressed her forehead to his. “All we have to do is kill the night king to kill them all.” She firmly believed that, even though he had told her over and over again that it was nothing but a theory, a theory that could cost thousands of lives if proven wrong. But she seemed to believe in him, in the theory and in their chances to survive.

And so he believed too. Maybe not so much in himself, but in her. “If we win this war…” Jon cleared his throat, but Sansa grabbed his lips and kept them shut before he could continue.

“When we win this war.” She spoke firmly now and she placed her other hand on his chest. “Winning this war is not an if. It’s a when.”

Jon smiled at her and she let his lips go again. “When we win this war, I will make you the queen you deserve to be.”

“The queen in the North?” Sansa wrapped her arms around his neck and her lips brushed his.

“No…” Jon shook his head and kissed her firmly. “The queen of everything. The North. Westeros. The world.” He paused to kiss her again. “But most of all the queen of my heart.”

Sansa buried her hands in his hair. “Are you implying now that I’m not the queen of your heart yet?”

His arms circled around her waist and he pressed her as tightly to his body as possible. “No…” He lifted her up. “You already have my heart.” He slowly walked away from the tree in the Godswood, towards the courtyard and the castle. “You already have my everything.” He ignored everyone staring at them. “And you already are my everything.”

“You have soldiers to command, King Jon Snow.” Sansa whispered, but Jon only smirked back.

“I don’t.” He used his foot to kick the wooden door open. “I have love to make.”

Written for day 2 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt PICNIC or GARDEN or GODSWOOD

Now he’s commanding one of the biggest armies Westeros has ever known, Jon understands why Ned used to come to the Godswood to think. And just like Catelyn, Sansa finds him there to comfort and encourage him.

Canon Divergent / Canon Compliant

As a little boy he had always wondered how someone could spend so much time with a boring tree that didn’t answer and didn’t react, but the older he got, the more he started to understand what Ned had been looking for.

Right now the tree was a calm in the storm. The courtyard of Winterfell was filled with soldiers and dragons. People were screaming, children were crying and horses were trampling around, terrified of the smell of death that lingered in the air. But here in the Godswood it was quiet and empty. It was the only place where the commander of the hugest army in the history of Westeros could think clearly.

Not that the huge amount of thinking he did lately got him anywhere. The army of the death was huge and endless. Whenever one of the living soldiers would fall, they would come back on the opposite side. At first they would simply fight stranger, nameless people with blue eyes. But then they would fight acquaintances and then they would fight friends.

It terrified him. Jon Snow, King in the North, dragon rider and the one living person who had seen death and lived to tell the tale, was terrified of what was to come. Not because he was afraid of dying himself. He had faced death way too often to still fear it. He was afraid of his loved ones dying. He was afraid of his friends and his family dying and not being as lucky as he had been.

But he was mostly afraid for her. He was afraid that somehow, at the end of the war, he would still be standing and she would be a corpse he would have to burn to death or fight to death.

“Jon?”

He looked up when he heard her voice, only a couple of inches behind him. When she placed a hand on his shoulder, he placed his hand on top of hers.

Canon Divergent / Canon Compliant

Jon let out a deep sigh. “And how should I be able to put them at ease?” He looked at Sansa and her bright blue eyes stared straight into his. “We all know that people are dying. His army is growing. And we’re here, doing nothing but waiting until he’s close enough to fight him.” He tensed all his muscles and clenched his fists.

She was taller than him, but somehow looking up at her was one of his favourite things to do. “They have no idea what’s coming for them and what they will face. But you have and you have to remind them what we’re fighting for.” Sansa swallowed. “We’re not fighting for a throne or power. We’re fighting for Westeros and for the living to stay alive.”

“You should have been the queen.” Jon tucked a strand of strawberry blond hair behind her ear. “You’d be able to encourage even the most hopeless man.”

Sansa smiled and curled her fingers around his wrist to press the palm of his hand to her cheek. “Are you hopeless, Jon Snow?”

“When we win this war.” She spoke firmly now and she placed her other hand on his chest. “Winning this war is not an if. It’s a when.”

Jon smiled at her and she let his lips go again. “When we win this war, I will make you the queen you deserve to be.”

“No…” Jon shook his head and kissed her firmly. “The queen of everything. The North. Westeros. The world.” He paused to kiss her again. “But most of all the queen of my heart.”

blog.name: lupinusalbus
blog.title: Lupinus Albus
blog.description:
Speculations about Game of Thrones...
(mostly the show)

summary: Jon Snow, Robb Stark, and Northern Perceptions
title: Jon Snow, Robb Stark, and Northern Perceptions
body:
In season 6 of Game of Thrones, we see Jon Snow crowned King in the North. This scene, although the circumstances are different, is reminiscent of his believed half brother’s crowning in season 1, episode 10.  Robb Stark’s Kingship ended with his own murder and horrific tragedy for his family.  He lost his Mother, wife, unborn child, thousands of men and his Direwolf when the Starks were betrayed at the Red Wedding.  The reasons for the massacre at the Red Wedding are directly attributable to an earlier decision by Robb to marry Talisa.  Although the plot was hatched by Tywin Lannister, Walder Frey staged the Red Wedding because Robb had broken the marriage pact between himself and one of Frey’s daughters.  The pact had been brokered by Catelyn Stark in exchange for the Stark forces being allowed to cross at the Green Fork during the War of the Five Kings.

The massacre at the Red Wedding was a profound loss for House Stark which almost lead to it being completely wiped out.  Winterfell and the Stark name were eventually restored only because Sansa Stark and Jon Snow defeated the Boltons at the Battle of the Bastards.  Currently on Game of Thrones, the Starks finally have a chance to replenish their dynasty, which had been thought by many Northern Lords to be “dead”.  Because of the Stark’s victory, Jon Snow, the supposed bastard son of Ned Stark, was named King in the North, as was Robb before him.  

During the time when Sansa and Jon are attempting to gain support from Northern houses to take back Winterfell, we hear sentiments expressed about Robb Stark by Lord Glover.  Glover refuses to support their cause and declares Hose Stark “dead” because of Robb’s  mistake of “taking up with a foreign whore”.  This feeling is no doubt shared by many other Northerners, who view Robb as having been foolish and naive.  Later, in season 7, Sansa alludes to Jon about Robb’s “stupid mistake”.  This mistake can be none other than his choice to break his oath to the Freys which lead to thousands of deaths and the near total eradication of the Stark name.  Sansa’a advice to Jon Snow is that he has to be smarter and avoid making these kinds of mistakes. The central “mistake” of Robb was to disregard his responsibilities and honor as King by breaking the marriage pact he had agreed to with the Freys.  Not only did Robb go back on his word, his actions lead to thousands of deaths and the victory of the Lannisters.  The implication of Sansa and Lord Glover’s words is that Robb’s decision to marry for love was foolish and irresponsible.

When Sansa tells Jon that he needs to be smarter, the two don’t specifically discuss what Robb actually did, but the foreshadowing of Jon’s future context is clear.  Robb’s downfall occurred because he followed his heart instead of doing his duty as a King by keeping his word.  Although Jon Snow’s situation with Daenerys is not identical, there are important parallels.  Robb jeopardized and ultimately lost his life and his title, thereby destroying the Northern claim, by making the rash decision to marry Talissa.  It literally cost him everything and thousands of his men were killed.  This is why Sansa called it a stupid mistake.  Although a case can be made that Jon’s decision to forgive the Umbers and the Karstarks was the right one, Sansa is no doubt thinking of other things that Jon has done when she counsels him.  Jon went against Sansa’s advice regarding the number of men needed to attack the Bolton’s, and he also fell into Ramsay’s trap by charging at him during the Battle of the Bastards.  The show is sending a message that Jon could be about to make more mistakes, just like Robb, and the mistakes could be related to acting on emotion rather than using logic.  They could also be related to behaving selfishly instead of keeping the greater good in mind.  

Although the audience does not get a window into Jon Snow’s thought processes with regard to Daenerys in season 7, he at first refuses to bend the knee to her when she demands it of him.  His reasons include the foundations of her claim (based upon her father’s claim) and his sense that the North would not submit to her.  Indeed he was specifically warned about the Targaryens before he departed for Dragonstone.  Jon would like to get Dany’s support and to be able to receive her dragonglass, but not at the cost of bending the knee.  He would like an alliance, but not one which involves submitting the North to a Targaryen.

Eventually, Jon does submit to her as Queen, and his problem upon returning home is going to be how this will be received by the Northern Lords and Jon’s own family.  Once the nature of his relationship with Dany becomes known, there will be protestations that he has taken up with a foreign woman in the same manner as Robb Stark.  The implication will be similar:  Jon is rashly giving away the North  in order to follow his heart.  The central question for the audience is whether Jon is making a stupid mistake or if he is actually behaving rationally. The answer to this question will perhaps rest upon whether Dany makes the difference against the Night King.  In this case, Jon’s bending the knee may garner support from Northerners.  However, if Cersei is going to attack from the South with the Golden Company and the North suffers heavy losses anyway, Jon will likely be blamed for bending the knee to Dany and thus exposing the North.

As of yet in the series, Jon Snow is unaware of his true parentage. Out of his sense of himself as a Stark and a Northerner he believes (whether he loves Dany or not), that he is doing what has to be done against a massive existential threat.  In light of the new trailer, it looks as though Sansa and the other key players in the show will have to accept Dany’s support for the battle against the Night King and the Whitewalkers. This battle is going to happen in episode 3, so the remainder of the show is going to be concerned with the aftermath and the consequences of Jon’s alliance in the context of a probable attack from Cersei and the parentage reveal.

blog.name: asweetdeception
blog.title: the girl who dreamt of stars
blog.description:
A m n a | multifandom

Ao3: asweetdeception

summary: Two things in s7 that really pushed me towards the kidnapping plot were: “I, too, would like [the Golden Company] to recover...
body:
Two things in s7 that really pushed me towards the kidnapping plot were:

“I, too, would like [the Golden Company] to recover some things that belong to me.”

“They want another Stark prisoner, they can come and take me.”

I’m not sure how I feel about the kidnapping plot yet tbh. I just hope that if it does happen, Sansa isn’t helpless and actually helps save herself. Also, I’m really really DYING to see a Cersei/Sansa confrontation (it’s needed and a long time coming) so this would give me that. But my personal feelings aside, I do see a lot of breadcrumbs hinting towards that plot and it would make narrative sense.

summary: I'm sorry if you don't ship it but if you do I'd love some Jonsa :)
question: I'm sorry if you don't ship it but if you do I'd love some Jonsa :)
answer: ahaha i don’t ship it but have some sibling bonding! jon is better at sitting still than arya so sansa likes practicing her braids on him!

blog.description:
Your tumblr source for HBO's "Game of Thrones" fantasy drama tv series & "A Song of Ice and Fire" epic fantasy novel series by George R. R. Martin. 
We post original content & check the public tag #gameofthronesdaily This is NOT a spoiler free blog.

blog.name: theblackbooknerd
blog.title: To All The Books I Loved Before.
blog.description: Tolani. Black. Nigerian. British. Bookworm. Nerd. Writer. Feminist. Law Undergrad. I like big books & long cheques. Fabulous like Sharpay & Boujee like Blair. Currently Reading: Again But Better, The Unhoneymooners & A Storm Of Swords

tags: long term planning is important kids
summary: remember when the show focused on showing us Sansa storing food for Winterfell and Daenerys burning up all the food from the...
body: remember when the show focused on showing us Sansa storing food for Winterfell and Daenerys burning up all the food from the Reach? and how Daenerys’s entire army is now in Winterfell. with no food of their own. so Sansa will have to figure out how to feed them. with the food. that was meant. FOR THE NORTH.

FOR THE NORTH.

trail.content: remember when the show focused on showing us Sansa storing food for Winterfell and Daenerys burning up all the food from the Reach? and how Daenerys’s entire army is now in Winterfell. with no food of their own. so Sansa will have to figure out how to feed them. with the food. that was meant. FOR THE NORTH.

tags: fun fact: earlier a dany stan reblogged one of my anti asoiaf fandom complaining about dany hate

blog.name: johnmotherfuckingshelby
blog.title: Broke Writer
blog.description: Hey guys, I'm Eleonora and I'm from Italy. Feel free to send in requests or to send me a message when you're feeling down or just need to rant. (I was @allisonsarrows)

body:
Requests

Hey guys, I think it’s time I open requests. I’m gonna be taking requests for:

  • Jon Snow
  • Sansa Stark
  • Steve Rogers
  • Bucky Barnes
  • Alex Summers
  • Kurt Wagner
  • Jasper Hale (yes I like Twilight, please don’t hate me)
  • Scott Mccall
  • Malia Tate/Hale
  • Allison Argent
  • John Shelby
  • Thomas Shelby
  • Michael Grey

summary: Sansa Stark Theories for Game of Thrones Season 8
title: Sansa Stark Theories for Game of Thrones Season 8
body:
Sansa Stark Theories for Game of Thrones Season 8

Sansa Stark is the elder daughter of Eddard Star and Ctelyn Stark, Sophie Turner is the real name of the actress who play the role of Sansa Stark in Game of Thrones. She started Game of Thrones with the very young age and now she grown up with the passing seasons of the GOT. She is the survival, She is now become a true lady of winterfall with ruling mind set.

Sophie Turner is going to play her…

View On WordPress
